text:
I keep getting "java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space" when I run JMS Topic threads for more than 10 mins (runs fine for 5-10mins), anything more than 10 mins always gives memory errors.  Looks like its the JMeter problem, as I get the same problem with OpenJMS/HornetQ/ActiveMQ engines.

I increased the heap by setting set HEAP=-Xms512m -Xmx1024m, in jmeter.bat and jmeter-report.bat.

Is this a known bug and being fixed?
creator: hikiran@gmail.com

text:
Are you sure it's not something else? e.g. expensive listeners?

See 

http://jakarta.apache.org/jmeter/usermanual/best-practices.html#lean_mean
creator: sebb@apache.org
hikiran@gmail.com
text:
I actually tried dropping jmx file onto jmeter-n.bat, it works fine for 30min run but to see the data which Im interested in (No. of Samples run and Throughput) I opened the GUI and used "Summary Report" listener and selected the results.jtl which is genereted from the non-gui mode, the fields Im interested in (Samples,Throughput) seems to cut of the digits so not sure if it is a known bug.

Is there an easy way to get the (Samples,Throughput) from the output.jtl I got from non-gui mode?

(In reply to comment #2)
> Is there an easy way to get the (Samples,Throughput) from the output.jtl I got
> from non-gui mode?

Please use the JMeter user list for support questions
creator: sebb@apache.org
sebb@apache.org
text:
I don't see the problem.

Please provide a simple test case if you wish to re-open the bug.
